bugs.title: CVE-2019-6472 kea: packet containing a malformed DUID

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-6472 kea: packet containing a malformed DUID

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in Kea DHCPv6 server, which can exit with an assertion failure if the DHCPv6 server process receives a request containing DUID value which is too large.

Reference:
https://kb.isc.org/docs/cve-2019-6474

Created kea tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1801644]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1801643]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

bugs.title: CVE-2019-6472 kea: packet containing a malformed DUID [epel-7]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-6472 kea: packet containing a malformed DUID [epel-7]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-6472 kea: packet containing a malformed DUID

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in Kea DHCPv6 server, which can exit with an assertion failure if the DHCPv6 server process receives a request containing DUID value which is too large.

Reference:
https://kb.isc.org/docs/cve-2019-6474

Created kea tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1801644]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1801643]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-7.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1801642,1801644

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: CVE-2019-6473 kea: packed containing a malformed code causing assertion failure

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-6473 kea: packed containing a malformed code causing assertion failure

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in Kea DHCPv4 server, which can exit with an assertion failure if it receives a packed containing a malformed option.

Reference:
https://kb.isc.org/docs/cve-2019-6473

Created kea tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1801655]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1801654]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

bugs.title: CVE-2019-6474 kea: ncoming client requests can lead to server restart

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-6474 kea: ncoming client requests can lead to server restart

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in Kea, where can cause a condition where the server cannot be restarted without manual operator intervention to correct a problem that can be deliberately introduced into the stored leases.

Reference:
https://kb.isc.org/docs/cve-2019-6474

Created kea tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1801658]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1801657]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.
